original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 330/331 to spot-next US dollar, bond yields down
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee closed at 330/331 in the spot next market, with dealers said as an ad hoc peg with an inconsistent peg arrangement weakened and bond yields continued to fall.
The spot next dollar (spot plus one day settlement) closed at 328.50/330 to the US dollar Monday.
In intra-day trading, one month dollar forwards were quoted at 335/336 rupees and two months 339/341. Three months was not active.

Under the ad hoc peg arrangement, the central bank buys dollars to build reserves (preventing appreciation and creating liquidity in a so-called strong side convertibility undertaking) but does not intervene or signal a rate when there is an increase in demand, leading to uncertainty and jitters in the market as the regime flips to a float suddenly.

Interventions start only after steep falls in the currency has put importers, exporters and remittance houses are un-nerved. There have been some sales over the week around 329 levels, market participants said.

So-called confidence busting ‘flexible exchange rates’ which defy laws of nature described by classical economists are found in defaulting countries and those with social unrest and currency depreciation.

Permanent falls in the rupee is triggered by inflationary open market operations. However, the confidence busting ad hoc peg has weakened and recovered once amid broadly deflationary open market operations this year.
Banks are also building up positions ahead of a debt exchange. The move requires higher domestic interest rates to keep the external sector in balance.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2030 closed at 14.45/60 percent Tuesday, down from yesterday’s close of 14.75/85 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2028 closed at 14.78/88 down from yesterday’s 15.00/15.00 percnt.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 15.30/35 down from yesterday’s 15.35/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 15.32/38 down from yesterday’s 15.60/90 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 15.80/16.00 down from yesterday’s 16.00/20 percent. (Colombo/July25/2023)
